snippet: A campaign of bombings, assassinations, defections and cyberattacks, which experts believe is mainly Israel’s work, seems meant to halt Iran’s progress toward a nuclear weapon.
abstract: Experts believe Israel is behind an accelerating covert campaign of bombings, assassinations, defections and cyberattacks in Iran, meant to set back Iran’s progress toward a nuclear weapon; campaign claims its latest victim when a bomb kills a nuclear scientist in Tehran.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Steven Lee Myers from Washington, David E. Sanger from Cairo, Alan Cowell from London and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: A campaign of bombings, assassinations, defections and cyberattacks, which experts believe is mainly Israel’s work, seems meant to halt Iran’s progress toward a nuclear weapon.

headline.main: Adversaries of Iran Said to Be Stepping Up Covert Actions
headline.print_headline: Iran Adversaries Said To Step Up Covert Actions
